pages.text: In War Dance $(thing)parrying$() is as simple as holding a registered weapon or shield in your hand and facing your attacker when they try to melee attack you.$(br)If done correctly you will hear a $(l)clang$() and damage will be negated.$(br2)A $(o)Configured weapon$() means any item which displays values such as $(o)"posture per attack" and "Defense posture multiplier"$() as part of their tooltips.

When parrying, health damage is negated. $(br)The posture damage taken is further modified by the $(l)Defense$() value of the user's weapon as a percentage.$(br2) So if you were meant to take 5 posture damage, but had a 0.8 multiplier on the parrying item, that hit will only deal 4 posture damage when parried.

Most weapons will not parry projectile based attacks, such as arrows from skeletons or pillagers. $(br2)To automatically parry and deflect projectiles you need to use items marked as $(#FFD810)shields$().$(br)Shields is usually restricted to actual shields, arbalests, large books, certain massive swords, doors, trapdoors and signs.

Some projectiles such as those $(o)enchanted with piercing, those which explode or are magical in nature$() may not be parryable either. You may see which projectiles have such special properties via the configs. $(o)(if you do make some configs. consider sending them in to help everyone. :) )
